sub_topic: Balancing chemical equations for inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the reaction between copper (II) sulfate and sodium hydroxide?
message_2:
The reaction between copper (II) sulfate (CuSO₄) and sodium hydroxide (NaOH) is a double displacement reaction, resulting in the formation of copper (II) hydroxide (Cu(OH)₂) and sodium sulfate (Na₂SO₄). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

CuSO₄ (aq) + 2 NaOH (aq) → Cu(OH)₂ (s) + Na₂SO₄ (aq)
